#Import Libaries
import os
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import plotly.io as pio
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots
import plotly.figure_factory as ff
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
pio.templates.default = "simple_white"
#Ignore warnings
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')
source.01ed956e:
fig = px.histogram(df, x="SalePrice", title="Histogram of SalePrice",
                   color_discrete_sequence=['mediumaquamarine'])
fig.show()
source.f84d952a:
agg_yr = df.groupby('YrSold')['SalePrice'].agg(Sum='sum', Count='count')
fig = px.bar(x=agg_yr.index, y=agg_yr['Count'], text=agg_yr['Sum'],
             title="Year Wise Sales", color_discrete_sequence=['slategray'])
fig.update_xaxes(title_text='Year Sold')
fig.update_yaxes(title_text='Number of Houses Sold')
fig.update_traces(texttemplate='%{text:.2s}', textposition='outside')
fig.update_layout(uniformtext_minsize=8, uniformtext_mode='hide')
fig.show()
source.21a3c74a:
import datetime
def month_label(mon):
    mon = str(mon)
    datetime_object = datetime.datetime.strptime(mon, "%m")
    mon = datetime_object.strftime("%B")
    return mon

source.b17e089c:
fig = make_subplots(rows=2, cols=1)
fig.add_trace(
    go.Box(x = df['OverallQual'], y = df['SalePrice'], name = 'Quality', marker_color = 'indianred'),
    row=1, col=1
)
fig.add_trace(
    go.Box(x = df['OverallCond'], y = df['SalePrice'], name = 'Condition', marker_color = 'cadetblue'),
    row=2, col=1
)

fig.update_layout(title_text="Overall Quality & Condition")
fig.update_layout(showlegend=True)
fig.show()

source.9f6a0b29:
YearBuilt = df['YearBuilt']
YearRemodAdd = df['YearRemodAdd']
GarageYrBlt = df['GarageYrBlt'].dropna()
hist_data = [YearBuilt, YearRemodAdd, GarageYrBlt]

group_labels = ['YearBuilt', 'YearRemodAdd', 'GarageYrBlt']
colors = ['blue', 'red', 'green']

fig = ff.create_distplot(hist_data, group_labels, show_hist=False, colors=colors, show_rug=False)
fig.update_layout(title_text='Distribution of Year Features')
fig.show()

source.7085158b:
1.	Very Poor
2.	Poor
3.	Fair
4.	Below Average
5.	Average
6.	Above Average
7.	Good
8.	Very Good
9.	Excellent
10.	Very Excellent
   
There is not house with **very excellent condition**. Even the overall condition of house is **average** we can see maximum sales in it, but coming to quality of house which is material and finish of house highest saleprice are houses with **very excellent** condition.

surprisingly saleprice for **average** and **above average** quality houses is not even crossing 300k. This were most number of sales are happening
source.9548d6cd: Year **2007** and **2009** has great number of sales nearly 61M, less number of sales are in year **2010**
source.771d8601: **Yes!** even the lotarea is more the saleprices are low due to there **year last modifed**. Which mean the age of house is very old.
source.01c960fd:
* A	Agriculture
* C	Commercial
* FV	Floating Village Residential
* I	Industrial
* RH	Residential High Density
* RL	Residential Low Density
* RP	Residential Low Density Park 
* RM	Residential Medium Density

RL zone are more in number and 75% of Saleprice is falling in between 200000 - 250000 and highest saleprice can be seen in this zone only.

That's clear because most perfer living in low density place, next followed by the medium density zone.
source.8ebc67bf:
TotalBsmtSF: Total square feet of basement area

We can observe the possible outlier near the 6000.
source.4171f44d: **SalePrice** is right skewed and about 50% of saleprice is around 160K. We can observe two outliers after 700K which are highest saleprice houses.
source.ca1a6432: Houses sold in **june, july** are more in number with total saleprice of **45, 44M** and in **january, february, december** with less number of sales.
source.c91d1fd6:
HouseStyle: Style of dwelling
	
* 1Story	One story
* 1.5Fin	One and one-half story: 2nd level finished
* 1.5Unf	One and one-half story: 2nd level unfinished
* 2Story	Two story
* 2.5Fin	Two and one-half story: 2nd level finished
* 2.5Unf	Two and one-half story: 2nd level unfinished
* SFoyer	Split Foyer
* SLvl	Split Level

More number of sales can be found in **1Story**, but the highest saleprice is in **2Story**
source.e77d0275:
MSSubClass: Identifies the type of dwelling involved in the sale.

    20	1-STORY 1946 & NEWER ALL STYLES
    30	1-STORY 1945 & OLDER
    40	1-STORY W/FINISHED ATTIC ALL AGES
    45	1-1/2 STORY - UNFINISHED ALL AGES
    50	1-1/2 STORY FINISHED ALL AGES
    60	2-STORY 1946 & NEWER
    70	2-STORY 1945 & OLDER
    75	2-1/2 STORY ALL AGES
    80	SPLIT OR MULTI-LEVEL
    85	SPLIT FOYER
    90	DUPLEX - ALL STYLES AND AGES
    120	1-STORY PUD (Planned Unit Development) - 1946 & NEWER
    150	1-1/2 STORY PUD - ALL AGES
    160	2-STORY PUD - 1946 & NEWER
    180	PUD - MULTILEVEL - INCL SPLIT LEV/FOYER
    190	2 FAMILY CONVERSION - ALL STYLES AND AGES 

SalePrice for **2-STORY 1946 & NEWER style** is more compare to other styles. **1-STORY 1945 & OLDER** got less saleprice in almost every year.
source.365d8b49:
Foundation: Type of foundation
		
* BrkTil:	Brick & Tile
* CBlock:	Cinder Block
* PConc:	Poured Contrete	
* Slab: 	Slab
* Stone:	Stone
* Wood: 	Wood

**Poured Contrete** and **Cinder Block** type foundation as more number of sales. But highest saleprice can be found in poured contrete type foundation.
source.e1f19833:
* From year 1990 more number of house are built.
* In year 1950 and from 2000's most of houses are remodifed.
* Building garage along with house started from 1950's.

Building garage along with house started from 1950's so the GarageYrBlt will be almost same as other year features which we can drop.
source.287cf13b:
Even the LotArea is **more** there is low saleprice, this could be due to house maybe very old.


Moreover YearBuilt, YearRemodAdd, YrSold, GarageYrBlt are Year columns which need to be converted into Original type.

We can drop YearBuilt & YrSold by calculating the **Age** of the house as feature input to ML model.


Binning the YearRemodAdd into Labels for better analysis.
source.24d317a7:
## Summary

The more luxurious the house is more expensive the saleprice is were we can observe in almost most of plots those two outliers. 
Most of houses are falling in 160k saleprice due to expensive houses we can see the skew in saleprice histogram.
Analysis each feature and corelating with other features can give a more better analysis in removing outliers rather than removing them directly.

Thank you **Upvote** the notebook if you find it usefull.
source.476896ba:
**Most of YearMod is within the same year of built which is already stated in the description.**
> YearRemodAdd: Remodel date (same as construction date if no remodeling or additions)

But the Saleprice increased for some houses if there any recent modfications.
